item.title: Bar Plot
item.description: Letâ€™s make a vector of class standing for our data science class. First load the libraries: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(devtools) library(ggplot2) #extracting the data query<-"SELECT name,HR FROM Teams WHERE yearID=1980 ORDER BY HR" result<-sqldf(query) #result is a date frame; headers and columns and rows- like a spreadsheet #type result in console after doing ctrl enter #to just see column type 'result$name' in console result$name<-factor(result$name,levels=result$name) #now result$name is permanently considered a factor, and now levels=result$name will order them the way you had them in the columns have x axis as team names #visualizing the data ggplot()+ geom_bar(data=result,aes(x=name,y=HR),stat='identity', color='blue',fill='black')+ coord_flip()+ xlab("Team Name")+ ylab("Homeruns")+ ggtitle("1980 Team Homerun Distribution") #coord_flip() flips the axis
